title: Widow of PC Andrew Harper leads 5,000 bikers in ‘ride of respect’
text:
PC Andrew Harper was killed just four weeks after his wedding day (Picture: PA)

The wife of a police officer who died responding to a burglary in August joined thousands of motorcyclists in a touching tribute to her husband today.

Lissie Harper was the passenger on her husband’s motorcycle, ridden by her brother Jake Beckett on the 15 mile ‘Ride of Respect’ from RAF Benson to Abingdon Airfield in Oxfordshire

She was followed by Mr and Mrs Harper’s immediate family, as members of the public lined the route to show their appreciation.

Organisers said more than £16,000 had been raised for PC Harper’s family and designated charities.

An RAF Benson spokesman said: ‘There were more than 4,000 people here, there were motorcycles as far as the eye can see. It might be closer to 5,000 people, actually.

An estimated 5,000 bikers showed up to pay tribute to the fallen hero (Picture: PA)

More than £16,000 was raised for PC Harper’s family and certain charities (Picture: PA)

Riders wear tributes dedicated to PC Harper (Picture: PA)

The family were ‘overwhelmed’ with the support they received (Picture: PA)

‘The family were overwhelmed with the support when they arrived, and a lot of money has been raised. People just wanted to show their respects.’

The 28-year-old officer, from Thames Valley Police, was killed on August 15 near the village of Sulhamstead in Berkshire.

He died from multiple injuries after being dragged under a van, four weeks after his wedding.

Around 800 mourners turned out for his funeral at Christ Church Cathedral in Oxford on October 14.

Suspects Henry Long, 18, from Mortimer, Reading, and two 17-year-old boys, who cannot be named because of their age, have been charged with murder and conspiracy to steal a quad bike.

Thomas King, 21, from Basingstoke, is also accused of conspiracy to steal a quad bike.

PC Harper was dragged under a van in Sulhamstead, Berkshire, in August (Picture: PA)

The procession was led by PC Harper’s widow Lissie Harper (Picture: PA)

Motorcyclist drove 15 miles from RAF Benson to Abingdon Airfield in Oxfordshire (Picture: PA)

A biker carrying a Union Flag pays respects to the hero copper (Picture: PA)
description: The family of PC Andrew Harper were 'overwhelmed' with support at the 'ride of respect' from RAF Benson to Abingdon Airfield, Oxfordshire
